text:
I'm gonna keep this short and sweet. Or bitter, in this case.

Kinh Do, if you wanted people to leave in disgust, having a restaurant full of roaches and rodents would be a quicker alternative than having the sorry excuse of a wait staff you have. Your cashier, a stiff and bored looking high school student, wanders aimlessly through the mass of waiting customers, while the managers find it amusing to tell people that tables are "not available"..and they sure aren't, not with the piles of food scraps and dirty dishes that are begging to be swept away. 

Fast-forward 45 min, and we're finally seated. Fast-forward 30 more minutes, and we're finally given some water in this dry Nevada heat. Oh, did I forget to mention that we grabbed our own napkins and menus after asking half a million times? Yuppers. Another 30 min of twiddling our thumbs and our orders arrive, and surprise surprise! Y'all guessed it. The order comes out wrong. 

I'm usually not one to be sarcastic, but at that moment, it was looking to be prettttty darn funny. And not like ha-ha funny, but I'm-about-to-give-you-a-penny-tip kinda funny.

I am a Pho at least 1x per week kinda girl - and I was dying for some during the long week in Las Vegas. I searched, and asked and then turned to Yelp - I am so glad I did. The owner's who are also the wait staff - are incredibly kind, lovely people.

We ordered two dishes to split - 

The Sliced Beef Pho was so aromatic, the thai basil was plentiful and fresh - everything was perfection. I don't think I've ever had broth that clean on the palate and just, well, perfect!

Vermicelli Noodles with Charbroiled Lemon Grass Chicken was just as wonderful as the Pho.  

It felt a little lonely in there - so I hope more people will check them out!

As a regular diner at L.A.'s best pho (Pho 87 in Chinatown), I wasn't sure how Kinh Do would compare. Well, I had nothing to fear. The pho is good, as is the Yangzhou fried rice. The best part I the meal was the BBQ Pork bahn mi. The bread was soft and not chewy, the pork was sweet and flavorful, and the pickled carrots and radish were just right. For $3, this beats Lee's any day.
Good service, clean restaurant, ok food.  The two employees there were really nice and helpful for our large group.  Hence the 4 star.

Cold in Vegas right now and pho hits the spot. 

They were a little short staffed I think, there were pleanty of empty tables that weren't bussed yet and I was the only person waiting and there was still a 5 min wait. Nonetheless it hit the spot

The chicken I had here was awesome Best I Ever Had in Vegas. The seafood dish was great. I like how fast they greeted us and seated us. I would recommend this place to everyone. too as well I did not feel rushed out the door and I did not wait for a long time for my food. I like how the server came over and spoke with us. like at Kim Long Pho you are rush out the door and you have to wait for a long time to get your food

Great little find before we head off to the airport at the end of our Vegas trip. The food were all very flavorful and different then the regular Vietnamese noodles. First time mom raved about fried egg rolls at any restaurant. Would definitely go back again.
I've tried many pho places in vegas Pho Kihn Do is by far my favorite the special combo pho is as close to Cali pho as it gets here in vegas. I'm so happy I found this spot.
Food here a not good at all. They put to much pho powder. Overall the restaurant kinda nice.
The pho was very good but unfortunately they forgot to bring us our appetizer so can't tell u much else. Poor service the fist time but much improved on the second visit.
My family and I came here twice a day while at Vegas. They have good food and great service. Bun bo hue here is good! Just don't sit by the restroom.
Food was alright. customer service was better than ph s 1. This place had TV and world cup was on. ph s 1 didn't even have a TV.

Very good Pho! I've had beef noodle soup in several US cities and this ranks among the best. I had beef and shrimp and it was awesome. The broth was very clear and flavorful. The customary vegetable plate was well presented and as fresh as I've seen. It's a can't miss here!

By far, my favorite Pho restaurant in Vegas.  The 'pho tai nam' and 'pho ga' is always on point.  There's just something about his broth that's too good!  The spring rolls are great too!  The owner is the nicest man ever.  If you're ever in the mood for an amazingly mind blowing story during your meal, ask the owner how he got to the US.

Found this place by accident.  Best accident I've ever had!  Planned on Pho Saigon 8 for the meatball soup.  This place put theirs to shame.  The broth was amazing and the side sprouts, basil, etc were so clean and fresh.   We arrived late (5 minutes before closing).  Asked if they were still open and they welcomed us in and gave us so much attention.  My sister asked the owner to select a dish for her and she was very pleased with his choice.  The  restaurant is clean, aromas awesome and  service was excellent.  I love this place and will be a regular there.  Can't wait to take my asian friends!

My wife and I just returned home from a fabulous dinner, and we couldn't wait to post this review.

We had spring rolls for an appetizer, the best we've ever had.  I ordered two grilled pork chops that came with rice, fresh salad veggies and broth. 

 My wife had stir fried beef tenderloin with lemongrass and rice, and we both had tea. To our amazement the check came to approximately $20.00. What a deal!!

The portions could feed a small army.  We had so much food that we had to take much of our dinner home.  

The service was A+ and the owner is very personable.  He deserves to be successful and we hope he is.

We're looking forward to a return visit.
The bun bo hue was great but the egg rolls were spoiled We had to tell them to take it back...gross.

Pho Kinh Do has came a long way. I remember eons ago this place was just a tiny little Pho shop with couple table to sit and two sweet middle age Vietnamese ladies sweatin it away in the kitchen under that scorching Las Vegas heat in the summer. The place used to be so stuffy n cramp that most customers were sweatin n sniffin happily while enjoyin their bowl of hot Pho broth or Bun Rieu. My recent visit to Kinh Do was a big suprise to see the transformation of how hard workiin one can achieved in America. The place has transform into a huge restaurant that can probably accommodate more than 100 people and their menu r much more extensive. It is also nice to see a restaurant that can stood the end of time! Congratulations to u Kinh Do to be another American success story!

We were looking for a quick banh mi sandwich in Las Vegas and Kinh Do seemed to fit the bill.  Our trip was well rewarded.  

In terms of atmosphere, Kinh Do is no different from any other Vietnamese/Chinese strip mall restaurant. The same uninspired decor, seating, and art fills the large room, with the exception of a flat screen television that entranced our two year old daughter.  However, Kinh Do makes up for its lack of atmosphere with excellent service, delicious egg rolls, and great banh mi.

The egg rolls were fresh and delicious.  They were smaller than we have normally seen them but the size worked well.  The rolls were crispier and stayed that way much longer.  And kudos to Kinh Do for serving lettuce and herbs to eat with the egg rolls without us needing to ask.  The egg rolls themselves made the trip to Kinh Do worthwhile.

In addition, we tried the pork terrine, BBQ pork, and chicken banh mi.  While I wasn't that big a fan of the BBQ pork (it was a bit too fatty for me), the vegetables, pate, and bread were excellent.  The pork terrine was great and the chicken was even better.  And at $3.50 a sandwich, you cannot go wrong.

We also tried the Thai iced tea.  It too was very good.  We will definitely visit Kinh Do in the future.  If you are looking for inexpensive, good food, I suggest you do so as well.

Pho broth is very tasty.  Portions are appropriate.  The Vietnamese sandwiches are cheap and even taste great as a to go sandwich if you're on the go.  Owners are friendly.  No long waits!  They know what char Sui is!

I was craving a banh mi so I hopped on Yelp and found this place. Outside it didnt look like much inside it was very clean. The owner even offered to let us see his kitchen saying how clean it was! While talking to him you can tell how passionate he is about his restaurant and it showed in the food.

I had the grilled pork banh mi and it was very tasty. There was a good amount of meat in it but it could have used a little more pate. Overall it was a great value for only $3! I also tried a bit of the broth from the pho and it was great. Once the temperature cools down I'll be back to order some. Til then the sandwiches will hold me over when I want to grab a quick lunch.

Good service and a clean restaurant. We started with the egg rolls, which were good and they are free when you check in with yelp. I shared a bowl of the number 7 Pho with my friend, it's so big we had left overs, and it was so good, really flavorful. The Vietnamese coffee is delightful. My other friend had the number 10 Pho and he said it was really good as well. Coming here will be a tradition anytime we visit Vegas.

The pho bowl has lots of fat.
Their ice water has only a few ice cubes floating on top.
The waitress kept on placing hot bowls of Pho between the little kids.
The restaurant does not have enough air conditioning. 
The restroom was old and dirty.

I love love love the BEEF SATAY NOODLE SOUP !!!! 
I'm so addicted! Do yourself a favorite and try it! 
I'm here twice a week!

The owner is very friendly, and the food is amazing. I live down the street so a walk here, fill up on Pho or a vermicelli bowl, and walk home. The wait is pretty short most of the time. 

Also, this place is clean and the owner prides himself on being very clean.

This is the best pho restaurant I've ever been to. 

#18 satay is incredible every time.

Checked in and received free egg rolls. Nice and crispy. It's yummy. They are very accommodating to the very least.  The only thing is that the chicken noodle soup is in beef broth rather than in chicken broth.

Great place for authentic Vietnamese food. You can tell if the restaurant is good base on the broth and their broth is good. The great part about this place is when you check in using yelp, they'll give you two free egg rolls. So don't forget to check in and show the server your phone.

aftter a long weekend in vegas, i needed some pho and some vietnamese coffee for the long drive home. kinh do had some good reviews and it wasn't too far from where we were. we walked in, and we were greeted and seated immediately. I've ordered a seafood pho and a vietnamese coffee. the Broth was pretty flavorful and was on point. and vietnamese coffee.. our waitress brought it out with a strainer and coffee still dripping into the cup. that was pretty cool. ive never seen that before. lets just say that coffee kept me up for a 6 hour drive. :) my overall experience with this place, the place was clean, the prices were reasonable, quick and polite service. i will be back next time when i'm in vegas. :)

Like most people, I check yelp before deciding which place go. There were many pho restaurants to choose from but we decided on Kinh Do but with much disappointment. I ordered the bun Bo ue(sp); not sure how to spell it but it's the spicy noodle soup. Very very salty. My fiancée had pho and she said it was descent.

Outstanding Vietnamese food even compared with San Jose & Westminster. 

The cà phê sa á (ice coffee w/ milk) is made the old way individually pressed and slow-dripped per order instead of mass produced hours earlier as is standard at most places now.

The bún bò Hu (central Vietnamese spicy beef noodle soup) is very savory and tasty with the beef and hocks carefully filleted for you (all the high flavor meat but no bones!).

The egg rolls have already been covered by other Yelpers and they are extraordinary with a light crispy skin and a fluffy stuffing of pork, rice vermicelli, shitake mushroom carrot and pepper that retains it's texture.

All this with very friendly bilingual service( I mean they are all truly fluent in English and are exceedingly nice, both points being in stark contrast  to other Vietnamese restaurants that serve good food.)

Seriously, try this place out.
Great broth! Authentic Vietnamese food! Service is sort of slow but food is tasty delicious! Customer service is not the greatest. Constantly had to flag down waitress.lol

I really don't understand why this place has such high rating. My partner and I ordered Pho Tai and egg rolls. It was terrible! The Pho is known for their broth. It was like eating instant pho noodle. The key flavors is the richness of the beef broth and the star anise. I could hardly taste both ingredients. And for the egg rolls. It was okay but the dipping fish sauce was gross! All I could taste was vinegar and water down fish sauce. It wasn't sweet enough and not very authentic to Vietnamese cooking. I have my fair share of pho restaurants through out California. This place by far was one of the worst food I have ever tasted. If you are going to represent vietnamese cuisine,  you have to at least stay true to it taste. Do a little more research. Eat out more and travel so you have something to compare it too. This place is a total miss for us.

This place is amazing.  Real official vietnamese food. The pho is great. But you have to order the eggrolls. They are hand made. You can see on my IG jus_willis I eat all around vegas and also travel to Asia every year to feast. So I like to think of myself of knowing true authentic Asian food and this place is it.  Dont wait any longer. Forget those other pho places. Try this place. You won't be disappointed.
Awesome! I love this place. The sausage goi coun is to die for, and the pho has a very flavorful broth. I highly recommend this place for some good but inexpensive Vietnamese food.

I judge a Vietnamese place by its pho and pork combination rice plate. The pho was not overly seasoned and the noodles were tender and didn't stick into clumps. The grilled pork didn't have enough seasoning and garlic, but wasn't bad. Would definitely consider this as an go to place for some good Vietnamese comfort food.

Great place, they offer thai tea for check in yelp people ! The price is so so but compare to what you get from the quality of food is in the middle 4 dishes = 54$ tip 10 grand total 64 so for some people may be reasonable for some people might be expensive depend on perspective ( ** my father in law try their thai ice tea he got diarrhea :(  at least they should ask for lactose tolerate people

Wow...with so many Vietnamese places on Spring Mountain Road...how do you choose?  Let me tell you...the grilled pork sandwich was one of the BEST I've ever had...and I've had plenty!  From San Diego to San Gabriel...Kinh Do really has great pork.  Wifey had the Bun with pork and there was a lot of meat just waiting to be devoured.  And then kick in the free egg rolls for checking in...such a deal!  Bun, sandwich, ice coffee...just over $17.00.  Have to say that the ice coffee was a little disappointing...didn't even fill half of the ice cup.  Other than that, this place was great!  Service cordial and quick.  Can't go wrong

Jan 2nd /2017 . The weather in Las Vegas around late morning was chill & windy. We arrival to Kinh do rest here there is only 3 tables w customers. The rest isn't busy at all. As we came in the man I assumed he was the owner of the rest greeting  and appointed us to seat on the table next to the door. We asked for the back seat or where else coz the cold & wind from outside when the door opened it kinda cold. We asked him if we can Seat to other table . he kinda says no but then waked back to the register cashier booth.  as he turn back and walked with his one's  hand & mumbling w" f". So 2 of us just about to seat down, & my My other friend saw his very rudeness attitude & told us didn't you see what did that guy just ... 
so sorry then we walked out the rest & gone to Viet noodle bar. Tkx god . the food & service was excellent. The rest even newer  & much cleaner . Wouldn't recommend to anyone to King Do rest.
Some really great pho. Service is great as well. I always come here during my vegas visits. Pricing is good. It's a lot better than pho kim long. Too expensive. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

This is The Best Vietnamese restaurant I've eaten at in Vegas. I wish there was one in Los Angeles. The place is clean, and the food is so fresh and delicious. The vermicelli, vegetarian Banh mi, and pho were to die for. The owner is super friendly as well.

Very, very good. Pho was amazing and the best meat balls. Side fixins for pho were very fresh and just washed before coming to table. Perfect!!!

Bon Mi special sandwich - just like above. Bread, veggies and pork very, very fresh as excellent. Great food and very clean. 

Certainly worth a stop in vegas.

Pho : 3stars (pho seems to have Americanized taste)
Bo kho 4 stars
Bun rieu 4 stars
Service: 3 stars (slow.. Not enough wait staff) 
Come for the food, do not use the restroom.

The pho was good. Nothing exceptional.  The broth was a bit sweeter than I'm use to.  The wrap on my spring roll was so thick and tough I thought I left the plastic wrap on it.  Too many options in China town to go back a second time

Awesome! Looking for some good food that's not as expensive as the strip--found Phi Kinh Do! It was a good choice. I'm vegetarian, and their menu does not seem Veg-friendly; however, they were very flexible and happy to modify menu items. I ended up getting (but having to share the generous portions) veggie pho (veggie broth*) and veggie banh mi. The pho was really good--lots of bok choy!--but the banh mi was amazing! I love banh mi, and I've never had one quite like this. Sweet potato and fried tofu 

The owner was super friendly and I'll definitely be coming back! Super convenient location, good prices, too. I was staying at Rio and it was just down the street. Would recommend--Pho Kinh Do it!

As I read so many people gave a good rates for this place . I thought I just have to try out . The bun Bo hue here is awesome!!!!!!! Also great service that's a plus . I would definitely come back again !

LOVE LOVE this place! heard about it from my mom and is now my favorite pho place!!! the staff was very nice and greeted once we walked in. the egg rolls are bomb as well as everything I ordered... go try this place it's worth it

My wife and I were visiting Vegas for a few days, and we like to try some of the local / off the strip places.  The restaurant is easy to find  and about 5 minutes from the north Strip (e.g. the Wynn).  

  We split an order of springrolls, a bowl of Satay beef soup, and a Bahn Mi.  The springrolls are not fried,  which I like. They are in a rice wrapper with shrimp, lettuce, rice, and come with 2 dipping sauces. The soup was delicious and very spicy (and I love spicy food).  The Bahn Mi was awesome - it was the best sandwich I have ever eaten.  The roasted pork was so flavorful, and the bread was a great french type baguette.

 The total was about $15 + tip, and there was more than enough food for the 2 of us (we have healthy appetites).  The service was great.  My wife and I wanted to go back for dinner but we had plans for a show so we couldn't.  We can't wait to come back the next time we are in town - It was that good!!!

The wife and I have tried most all of the fall restaurants in town, and this is by far the best one. We came here from Los Angeles and are used to getting great pho so our expectations were high. The pho here tastes wonderful and has a full flavor, the eggrolls with the lettuce wraps are fantastic and I love  the iced coffee which is fresh made. We come here every week and have come to know all of the staff by name. They also know us and give us a very nice greeting and wonderful service. We love this restaurant.
Such great service and excellent food. I had the #7 and some hot tea. Perfect on this 40 degrees day.

I really enjoyed the the pho here. Tried the #5 and I fought the broth was very tasty and had plenty of noodles and meat to fill the belly. Service was great, so far my favorite place for pho in Las Vegas.

Lets just get one thing clear. We are aPHOicianados when it comes to Pho and all things asian. We have eaten Pho all across the valley so you can be sure that when we say these guys Pho is straight Bommi Mommi, we mean that. If you think Pho Kim Long or Pho so 1 is good Pho, then you better get to this joint and see what truly legit pho tastes like. This is our 5th time here in the past couple weeks and each time its as good or better than the last.The broth is clear, flavorful, fragrant and sublime. Something that other pho joints are slipping on these days. the bbq pork banh mi is the best we had in vegas so far, the pork so juicy, the veg pickled just right and the bread the right combo of chewy and flakey. The owner is always there and is super friendly. They show videos of vietnam, its people, its culture and its food on the flat screen, that captivates diners.
Sabroso. I was right, if most of the customers are from the country of the food, it is always a good sign!
This place is awesome the prices are good the food is amazing I love it!!!! The service really nice too, fresh pho!!!!

I've been eating a Pho kinh do for 5 years now and I've got to say it's the best Pho in Las Vegas. Hands down there broth is always on point with the right amount of flavor. I recommend this place to everyone that want to eat the best Pho in town.

Not sure why this place doesn't have a better review. 5 stars with me. The pho here is very clean, soup clean, portions good, sandwiches good, employees friendly. The pho was not oily and tasted really good. 

Imo, way better than other local pho places that are known to be famous because their 24/7. Other places overprice, with small portions, and their soup straight up is oily and msg because i get thirty. 

Kinh Do underrated and definitely deserve a try guys.

4 stars. I ordered the grilled bbq pork bahn mi sandwich. It was very flavorful pork and a good sized portioned.  The veggies were perfectly pickled and loved the extra cilantro.  Bread was fresh crunchy on the outside soft and absorbant on the inside. The only downside was the service, I think they are short staffed, I waited a long time before I could even get my to go ordrer in. But definitely would go again for a sit down meal. 4$ for the sandwich !! great price!
This place is a great. If I lived in Vegas I would be a regular for sure.  Great food + great service + clean = happy me.

I've tried a lot of pho places all around the east coast (where I'm originally from), a couple in CA, and some in Vegas, and Kinh Do is undoubtedly the BEST broth I've ever had!! I never knew the broth could be so good BEFORE putting all the condiments in!!! I am so happy I found this place not too long after I moved to Vegas. Never going to a different pho spot ever again!!

This place does it right!  Very affordable simple place with effortlessly great service and really good food.  Very casual basic dining room, strip mall location in Chinatown.  Only reason I can't give it 5 stars is the ambience just isn't that amazing so it doesn't deserve to be on par with 5 star places but everything else is just great.  Loved the family vibe and the people.  Food wasn't the absolute best I've had but it was 100% grubbin' and DELICIOUS and such a nice respite from Strip prices.  Recommended

Rule no 1 is to always order no 1. But don't miss out on the banh mi. The bread is made fresh and it was so tasty. The pho was great. Not good but great. The broth was hot until the last bite. I'm a meat lover and there was plenty of meat. Yum. Service was also good.
Very solid pho, everyone in our party enjoyed their dishes.  My broth was tasty, noodles al dente, and meat was good too.  Recommend.

I come here for the Grilled pork Bahn Mi sandwich.  I've had many in Vegas, SoCal, Texas, & GA.  Kinh Do's is the Best Bahn Mi. There are other Vietnamese restaurant that have good ingredients for the sandwich, but Kinh Do puts it all together.  Many fail when it comes to the bread. Some are too hard & tears up your mouth. Kinh Do's bread has the right amount of crunch to it without the hurt.
Service here is great! I personally like the hu tieu nam vang. Everything was good from the noodles to the soup to almost everything in the bowl. Will definitely come here again.

Not too sure why this place is so highly rated. But, after getting into LV I wanted some pho and this was one of the top places. I went on a late Monday afternoon (9/19). Service was fast and quick. But, the pho broth was flavorless and really sweet for some reason. Also the noodles were over done and a big blob of noodles. Maybe it was an off day, but I will not return.

Came here recently when I was in town and they've improved their service a lot. The owner came by to check on the tables to make sure everything was going well. The food was good as always for Vegas style pho. My friend ordered a Banh Mi and she really liked it. If you want to watch any games while you're eating, they'll change the channel so you can watch them.
Authentic food and yummy. Even its chinese dish is good. Sitting in the restaurant makes you feel like you are in another country though. Check-in for free spring rolls!

Canh Chua CA bong Lau is great.  Pho tai also way better than little Saigon pho.  We came to Las Vegas yesterday and accidentally tried pho Little Saigon.  Bad decision.  Don't go there.  Go to this kinh do instead.
Great pho!!! Bun Rieu is amazing too. A lot of flavor and a lot of stuff in the soup.

I tell you what, all the tourist who come to town are surely missing out on this spot. My friends took me to this spot. Being from the Bay area, I all ways love to explore Vegas, outside the strip, considering I use to live here too. Anyway, I had some tea, shrimp rolls, soup. Very good price, good service, quiet. Made my night. Gotta thank my friends for hooking me up for dinner. I will surely return on my next Vegas trip.!!

For really good Pho, it's all about the broth and they really have an amazing broth. The staff is very friendly, the restaurant clean and everything we ordered was fresh and delicious! So far we have been twice and each time was great!
Best bun bo hue I've ever had. Comes spicier than other places and the meat is incredible.

The price was acceptable, the restaurant was clean, the service was fine, people were nice. But I won't recommend for Asian people come here. I've always ordered Bun Bo Hue whenever I came to Vietnamese restaurant. But this is the first time I couldn't even finish it. I've ordered Bun Bo Hue, yet it tasted like Bo Kho. I was so disappointed!!!

First time trying this place because another friend liked their pho and I wanted to give it a try. I think the pho and nem nuong was just ok- not great but not horrible either. I will most likely not be back and just go to my regular spot for pho. The service was good though and they had a check in for a free thai iced tea which was a plus.

First time i at here last week the food was pretty good.

Yesterday when i ate here the food was ok

The egg rolls are good
  
The pork patty rolls are pretty flat. No flavor

The pho special is decent

The satte noodle soup was really good and really spicy

After long drive and visiting Las Vegas area, feeling and looking for Vietnamese Pho restaurant.  With the help of Yelp land to this place.  No regret all the food ordered are good.  The pho, dry vermicelli with bbq pork and spring roll, and the beef stewed Noodle soup.   The last happen to be the least favorite.

Friendly people and service are pretty good.  Can improve by asking during meal for checking and refill drink.

Will comeback to try different items.

Absolutely great place after a night out on the Vegas Strip either dancing or drinking the night away. 

Me and a couple of 3 other buddies decided to stop here and did the egg roll check - in special.  Service was so nice they threw in 2 extra ones at no cost. Best place after a hangover to enjoy some authentic Vietnamese food.

We were thinking about stopping by the other highly reviewed Vietnamese restaurant on Yelp, but ended up here on accident since our original place was hard to find. Good mistake. Would come back again.
The food was great. Large petitions with a meaty, well developed broth. One star off for less than great service. The waitress ignored the first request for a to go box.
Seriously the BEST! Brought me back to some of the best restaurants/ eateries in Vietnam! You won't regret this one. Their Bahn Mi is fantastic! Stew beef & Hue noodle is to die for!

We came here because of the good reviews on yelp.  This place is located in a strip mall across from the big plaza with a 99 ranch.  To our surprise, it took us a while to find parking, even at 8 pm on a weeknight.  

We got the following:  Pho, Bun Rieu, and grilled pork over rice.  The Bun Rieu (crab, tomato, egg, and pork stew with noodles, 8.95) was absolutely delicious! The broth was both savory, sweet, and addicting. I substituted pho noodles for the vermicelli which made it even better.  

The grilled pork with broken rice tasted average, but the Pho was pretty decent.  Service was a bit slow, but I let that go 'cause the older waiter seemed genuinely kind.

We in vegas for a few days, craving for some vietnamese food. We found this place on yelp with such high rating. This is a regretful decision. They serve the one of the worst pho and com tam ever. Hmmm, I wonder if the owner have deliberately star up his own place.

SATE!!!!! Love it, the best in town. 
Free egg rolls with check in? LOVE.

Only thing is that the kitchen works reallyyyyyyy slow. Normally at other pho places, your party's dishes all come out at the same time or at least right after another. Here tho, your friend will get their dish first, finish half of it, then you'll get yours. lol. But I mean, they don't have rude customer service or anything so I'm ok with waiting a little bit.
Great place for Pho and great remedy for a hangover! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Whenever we visit we stop here a couple times.
When you're in Vegas and want GOOD Vietnamese food, this is the spot. I've had the pho, bun rieu, mi bo kho and so far so good.
Food isn't too good. Service is terrible. Food was super slow. It took 45 min to just get some pho. They are under staffed and the customers suffer for it.

Look, I'm a Chef and I own my restaurant.  I drive across town every week rain or shine to go here.  It's literally the best the entire city and China Town has to offer period.  I don't know what else I can say, other than I'll see you there!!!

Found this restaurant on yelp! They really do have good pho! The place was packed very quickly right at opening time. Service was prompt got our food right away. My husband kept talking about how good their pho was.

Their banh mi are addictive.  Bun is amazing.  Egg rolls are off the chart.  Haven't had the pho yet, but have had the broth and it is fantastic!  Service is very attentive, but don't get upset when your bill doesn't come because you pay up front!  Kinh Do? Can Do!
Absolutely wonderful food! We got Hue Bang and it was the best we've ever had. Check in on yelp to get complimentary egg rolls!
They have the best Pho Dac Biet and Bún bò Hu in Las Vegas  Service is great and food is amazing!! I come here at least twice a month to satisfy my pho cravings.

I decided try this place out because of the good reviews.  This place is hidden in a small plaza.  It was empty when we got there at noon on a sunday.  The food came out fast and The egg rolls were very tasty but i thought the pho was just okay. The food was fresh and the service was good.

First visit tried the Banh Mi Dac Biet. Was quite good. My local preference for Banh Mi is Dakao, and that comes down to the bread, which wasn't bad at all at Kinh Do, but I think Dakao is a cut above. Others disagreed and preferred the bread here, so YMMV.

The innards of the sandwich I think were quite comparable. I want to do a side-by-side, but I will definitely be back at Kinh Do. OTOH, they were really really slow. I think I waited 15-20 minutes for a Banh Mi. But for $3.75 I guess who cares? Also my total was like $4.05, and I paid with a $5, and the woman there gave me $1.95 change. Rungood! But I gave it back, because, you know, karma and all.

Second trip I followed the Yelpers and got Bun Bo Hue. This was delicious, though with the offal and cubes of blood not really for the squeamish (stick to the pho). I will absolutely work soups and banh mi from here into my Vietnamese rotation; this is considerably better than some other places I've tried in town.
Best bun bo rue I had so far. Great service will come back next time I am in the area.

Lunch was yummy!!  We checked in with the six of us and received 6 rolls of eggroll. Their egg roll was delicious which comes with veggie for wrapping!!  The Hu Tieu Nam  Vang was super tasty with Tong-O veggie. I have never had Hu Tieu with Tong-O before.  They came together so nicely..  Love it!!  The services here is super wonderful also. Good food, wonderful services... What else can you ask for?? For sure a 5 stars!!
Super delicious!!! Every time when I'm in Vegas, pho is always a must and this is the place to enjoy some delicious pho!

Very fresh and Fast service.The Pho broth is perfect.The food is clean and the place is clean.What best you can expect from all Pho or Vietnamese restaurant.The only thing that did not get 5 star from me is the ambiance.Yes for restaurant is count.

The food is cheap compared to most other viet restaurants. I ordered sandwiches from them before.  They taste better than the vietnamese place across the street.  $3 a sandwich, it doesn't matter what kind. Chicken or Pork rolls, whatever.  I think I will be back here every sunday to get my monday lunch!

We went here for a late lunch one day after shopping.  The place is pretty big and had Vietnamese TV programs on.  It was moderately busy which is pretty good since it was around 1:30pm.  My kids split a Pho and there was plenty for both of them.  I had the noodle bowl (not soupy) and there was a lot of meat and very good overall.

Pricing was good and we were full.  We'd definitely come back.  This restaurant is located in the Chinatown area and there's various other restaurants in the area but this one had very good reviews on here so we decided on this.

When I am sick, the one thing I want is Pho.  I enjoy that it doubles as food and as a steam bath.  So, in a summer-cold-induced delirium, I decided to check out Kinh Do.

I'll admit, I was strung out on Nyquil when I dined at Kinh Do, but I remember it as fantastic.  I ordered the #9 Pho (with brisket and rare steak) and it came with a big helping of fresh bean sprouts, basil, jalapenos, and limes.  The broth was really flavorful and, in a first for me, I actually devoured all of the broth.  I usually leave a half-full bowl (to allow for the steaminess).  Um, yes, I will be back for this, sick or not.

We also ordered the egg rolls for the appetizer because they were free if you mentioned Yelp.  I'm not a big egg roll fan but these were amazing despite looking like burned, freezer-aisle rejects.  And, because they are not your typical Panda Express egg rolls, they come with lettuce, jicama, and carrots.  Even if you don't like egg rolls (like me), just get them a shot, you might change you mind.

The one thing I probably won't come back for is the Banh Mi.  It's a fantastic value at $3.00, but the bread is not to my liking.  Way too soft and without that French baguette crunch.  The sandwich (specifically, the mixed meat) also lacked enough cilantro or jicama to hit the spot, but was an overall tasty dish.  I just can't get over the bread though.

I cannnnottt wait to try everything else and enjoy the steamy Pho another day.  Also, my cold started to recede the next day.  Coincidence? Probably, but Kinh do does have some great food. I'll be back.
This place has awesome Pho!  I am a  PHO lover, and I just fell in Love.  Customer Service was excellent!  Go now and try this place!  You won't be disappointed!
The favorite place to eat a sandwich.  They rock. Service is nice and friendly.  Food is delicious, but honey bbq pork sandwich will leave you speechless.  Sooo delicious.

Service was bad. We waited to be seated and a lady we thought work there sitter us. Come to find out, she was a customer waiting for her togo food. She was still waiting when we finally left. Service was not there. Waiters attend to others that came in after us. Three table waiting to order including us. A party of two. When we ordered, I asked no onions and no tripe for my bf. I got a bowl of bland, onions, and no tripe  in my special pho. Little meat and only half of a meatball in my bowl. Broth was bland. I don't think it was the pho broth. I order the grilled pork spring roll. It was not great. I don't think the used the right kind of pork.
Overall, they need to trained the wait staff. Be organized and understand what the customer ordered. Have a hostess and a cashier. We could easy walk out with out paying.

Would recommend this place for anyone looking for a typical Vietnamese establishment.  We had the vermicelli which was surprising for 2 reasons.   First I usually have these dishes with the noodles cold and these were warm and second, the noodles were thicker than I usually see.  Nonetheless, all the flavors were great and egg rolls were delicious.  They even had Che ba Mau a tasty refreshing desert drink made with coconut milk if u feel inclined. 

Happy eatings!

I ordered "banh tam"...which I usually have to make it at home because not all restaurants have it. I usually make mine w/shredded pork (bi) and meatballs (shrimp and ground pork). Well, this place didn't make it w/ meatballs, but it came with grilled pork! My eyes were wide open and I indulge right away! It was one of the best banh tam I ever had! I never thought of having grilled pork with it! Awesomness!!! Banh tam is served with mixed vegies, coconut milk, and nuoc mam (fish sauce). And they offered 2 free eggrolls if you check in! :)

In writing this review as I'm waiting for my food. We've been waiting foreverrr wtfff. We ordered our food 50min ago and only 1 out of 4 people have gotten their food. When I eat Vietnamese food, I don't wait any longer than 10min for my food to come out. Maybe the heat is getting to everybody here...

hurting after a long night, so we decided on some Pho for lunch. 
it was just the closet to where we were staying, so we hit it up.
The was pho was pretty good. i just got the reg combo pho. can't go wrong with it.
ordered a grilled pork sandwich for later, pretty good,(great call be me).
Checked in on yelp and there was a free 2 eggrolls! come up! and the server was like oh i got you i'll bring some out for everyone! 
Service was on point, took care of us like some VIP's. 
Ordered a bunch of pho and sandwiches to go and they got it all together and ready to go when we were done eating, perfect timing.
All in all good food and great service.

This place is a true hidden gem close to the strip. The pho is flavorful and their banh mi is the best I've had in Las Vegas hands down. If you have never been here before I totally recommend this place and give it a try you won't be disappointed.
Great food and great service. As good as new york. They gave us free spring rolls and treated us like regulars.

best all around vietnamese food in las vegas.

the pho broth is definitely the best tasting out here. their vermicelli dishes are good. they offer broken rice, and have banh mis. it's hard to get all of these in one vietnamese restaurant!

Pho broth has a unique tast. Maybe they add dried cloves or something. Yhe noodles were cooked perfectly and the broth was not too salty. Checked in here and got the 2 free eggrolls. They were greasy, but man were they crispy and tasty. I will have to try the vietnamese sandwiches next time. $6.95 for a bowl of pho is also very reasonably priced. 

Props to the owner for actually coming to each of the tables to check on the customers.

Pho King Do sits atop the Las Vegas pho market.  It's a tie, in my opinion, with District One for overall pho-licious food mastery, but Kinh Do is more of a casual, chill forward environment (if that's possible).  As in most modestly priced food havens, come for the food, not for the sucking-up-service, and you will be very happy you did.  Half the cars outside have out of state plates, every time.  This is a destination food-stop for people who love straightforward, delicious food with no frills.
Pho broth is good and they have some other good order.  Tried the satay egg noodle after my sister had ordered it and it was bomb!!

I think I may go back.  I am trying to remember how it was but the only aspect of the experience that stands out was the pho broth was standard compared to its neighbors.  Location is a bit hair raising but that should not stop anyone from trying it.

What a great place to eat!  I don't know about some of the other reviews but I had a wonderful time and the food was great.  Definitely check in and get the free egg roll.  It was delicious and not your everyday eggroll.  The staff came over and showed us how to eat them properly and she told us about the properties of the herbs and how they affected your health.  The Pho was great.  I am no connoisseur but the broth was delicious and the meats were of good quality.  The service was personal and heart warming.  It was not busy when I went on a weeknight around 8:30 PM.  Check it out.  Oh ya, the price was good too.

A trip with family to Vegas means no clubbing or drunken shenanigans. First thing on our to-do list? Look for a Vietnamese restaurant.

The Vietnamese-Chinese cuisine sign initially deterred us from Pho Kinh Do but to our pleasant surprise, it turned out to be more authentic and tasty than many Vietnamese restaurants in the Bay Area. We ordered the family menu which included dishes like Ca Kho To (catfish in claypot), Canh Chua (tamarind soup), Ga Xao Xa Ot (lemongrass chicken) and Thit Kho (sautéed pork). My family, including those visiting from Vietnam, agreed the food was flavorful and comparable to a home-cooked meal.

Well.. This restaurant sucks! I wrote my name in a waiting list.. In that list, I have 2 party in front of me.. But after 15 mins of waiting the owner or server change my Que number to 5 for no reason. I think they give it to other people that he knows! Terrible.. Suck..

The worst pho I've had ever! The broth tasted odd, it's really hard to explain but it did not taste any other meat based pho broth I've ever had and it definitely not enough salt, or taste.  I usually the combo with tripe, tendon, flank and other yummy meats. This pho was not yummy at all. The service also was horrible. We never got checked on how we were doing during our meal, no drink refills and basically at the end had to hunt someone down for our bill to leave and it was NOT busy at all. The only high point where the bahn mi sandwich but still lacking meat and veggies in my opinion. I will stick with my usual place instead. 
Stay away.

Found this place through yelp. It was so good that after our first time we went back 2 days in a row after that. The staff here are so friendly! The portions are huge and the prices are extremely reasonable. Their banh mi is soooo good! Way better than Lee's because its fresh, full of flavor, and they cost the same. This is the best Vietnamese food we had since moving here to Vegas from Hawaii.
The Banh Xeo was nice and crispy.  We checked in to get the free eggrolls.  They gave us an extra eggroll. Yum.

(Insert corny "Pho" joke here)

Kinh Do has some of the most flavorful food  in the valley.  The prices are fair, the service is friendly, and they stay open until 10 O'clock everyday. 

The menu here has a lot to make your mouth water, but what still has me salivating are the egg rolls and the Bahn Mi.

The Egg Rolls were perfectly crispy, like little golden rolls of heaven.  They weren't too greasy, and packed serious flavor.  

I had the Bahn Mi with shredded pork, sorry I cannot recall it's proper name.  As I brought the sandwich to my lips, I fell under the fragrant spell of a perfectly executed dish.  The aroma of fresh cilantro and tender pork were so rich and intoxicating, I briefly forgot where I was.  

I'm planning on coming back to Kinh Do this week for more of that unbelievable Bahn Mi..  Mmmm mmm!

Like many other asians, I must have PHO the day after a long night out in Vegas.  I busted out my phone and started yelping for a good pho place since I am one of the picky-pho-eaters out there.  Thankfully, this place popped up and away we headed to it.  When we got there, it wasn't crowded so we were seated immediately (next to a fan too = a plus since it's summer right now).  I was a little skeptical with the pho that I ordered but at that point, I had no choice.  I just needed to inject some of that pho broth in my vein to feel alive again.  To my surprise, pho at this place wasn't so bad....in fact, it was GOOD! I literally devoured my bowl in no time.  The broth wasn't watered down like at some places I went to nor was the noodles too hard or too mushy.  The temperature of the broth was perfect  ( I like my pho to be hot and not just luke warm).  For sure, the next time I find myself in Vegas again, I will definitely stop by to get my pho-craving fulfill.
As Pho goes you have to give this place a try.  Ya it's right next to Massage parlor but this place is legit. Then you have to get the egg rolls...Woweeee Wow!! Totally unexpected.

I have to say that i was extremely disappointed with this place. My friends and i had a pho craving after a fun vegas night. Hoping to find a good pho place i came on yelp to research vegas pho places. Figured that this place would be amazing with 569 reviews and 4 stars.... we came to try it out. At first we were really excited,  but that almost immediately changed when our waitress gave us attitude. One of my friends asked for a sprite soda and she rolled her eyes at him... then one of my other friends wanted a fork so we asked for one and she yelled at us "can't you see I'm busy!!"  And walked away.  Then when the food came I had almost lost my appetite.... but i was not gonna let her bad attitude deprived me from eating... i ordered a chicken banh mi and  rare steak,flank pho. It was just okay.... the chicken was a bit dry and almost seemed like they skimped out on it... the pho did not hit the spot... very little meat and the beef broth just didnt cut it for me.  I would give this place a 1 1/2 stars if possible.  Stay clear from this place. Im sure there are much much better places out and near by to hit that pho craving

The service is great, but I didn't feel it was very hygienic. But most Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas was like this if you go off the strip.

I ordered the Bun Bo Hue, it was OK I've had better, but I guess it's Vegas so you cant really expect much.  

My boyfriend had the Pho Tai, he said wasn't anything special but he would come back again for it.

Went here for lunch on a weekend and they were really busy.  I ordered the beef combination pho and I thought it was really good.  I can tell that the broth here is noticeably more flavorful than others I've had recently, and that the flank steak pieces had this smoky/bacony yummy flavor that I don't remember tasting before when eating pho.  We also ordered some spring rolls, which were fresh, tasty, and very refreshing.  The service was slightly delayed but it's understandable because of how packed they were, and they're packed for a reason.  I give Kinh Do a solid 4 stars for our visit.
The pho was good but I had better. The workers are nice and attentive.

Good Vietnamese.  Very Authentic

Order the Iced Coffee.  Some of the best Iced Coffee I've had.

My boyfriend and I were craving some pho with this cold weather and we came across this restaurant. OMG they had awesome pho and most of all the best bahn mi ever. We are from LA and have tried different places for bahn mi and this one tops it. The bread is not too hard and the flavors infused in the bahn mi is fabulous. We will definitely make this place a key spot every time we come to Vegas.

What I tasted?
Pork chop with broken rice was so dry.  It was very hard to eat it. Vegetable dish was on the oily side. Beef stew noodle soups was good so noodle soups are safe.

Any Yelp check-in offer?
The offer was 2 Free Egg rolls. We were able to redemn but they only allow one person to redemn per table. The egg rolls was very tasty but deep fried many times. They don't give lettuce and fish sauce with the egg rolls like other Vietnamese restaurants.

This is the second Vietnamese restaurant that I've tried out in Las Vegas. Kinh Do has really good and nice service and the food is spectacular. I checked in and got my two free eggrolls which were pretty good. The pho broth was very flavorful and you can taste the originality in it. The Cafe Sua Da is very good and the lady was very nice when I asked for more coconut milk and brought it out straight away. Inside it looks very modern and clean also. Great restaurant and will remember to come here next time I'm Las Vegas!

I stumbled upon this restaurant while I was looking for something quick at YELP. planned to have brunch at the peppermill but we all know the wait is just TOO LONG. I am so glad I found this hidden gem!! The pho broth was so flavorful, not salty. The food was fresh, seasoned well and perfectly balanced. The banh mi? probably the best that I've ever had!the right amount of meat, picked vegetables and cilantro plus extra jalapeño? OMG. I also asked if they bake their own french baguette but they said no. I was surprised because the bread tasted so fresh, crunchy but soft and just melts in your mouth.  and the staff was so so nice. They brought out our food super fast considering the restaurant was half full. I will definitely be coming back here again soon for sure since I go to vegas almost every month.
Bad service. Not authentic Vietnamese food. Very salty. Run down coffee. Not sure why a long line and 4 stars yelp review. A hype. Will not go back again

Really good pho and drinks. The broth is super tasty. Price is on point and not inflated like the restaurants near the more touristy areas of Vegas "Chinatown." Looking forward to coming back here in the future!
Good Pho and has a TV.  Here is tip for the waiter.  Don't pull open candy out of your pocket and hand it to 14 month old baby.  We would  go back .

Ok, so I've been here a dozen times, and I can confidently say this is my favorite pho joint. The service is more than on point, and the food even more so. To each their own, and I've been to a handful of Vietnamese places in town, but this is by far my favorite. Can't recommend enough. Enjoy!!!

Dishes are huge, basically family size at this very family-oriented eatery. The two egg rolls that came for free with the Yelp check-in we're amazing, and the Grilled BBQ Pork Banh Mi was to die for. The satay dish, however, was a bit underwhelming, and certainly no substitute for the curry dish I wanted to order but they were out of. All in all an awesome meal though, and I'll be back for more.

Yeahhh! This place hit the spot.  


We got here pretty late after a long drive from CA. It was cold and raining. We needed something to warm us up. 
The soup base had a good flavor.  For what I could remember the portion size was big enough to share.  Lots of meat and greens filled my bowl just how I like it.  Service was good and fast. I'll be back again.

Decent food. I had the Bun Bo Hue and some egg rolls with the additional 2 free egg rolls for checking in on Yelp. Service was good and attentive. The server kept refilling our water and asked us if we were okay. I'd probably look for other places, though.

Came here for dinner on a week night with 3 other friends. There was just one other table other than us.

Service 4 stars- service was pretty good. Waiter came to us quickly and got us water and asked if there was any other drink we wanted. We each checked in and got either a soda or Thai iced tea. 

Food 3 stars- I got the pho tai. Decent pho noodles but I noticed the broth was very oily. Meat was decent quality and noodles were cooked well, but the broth was probably a 1.5 at best with the flavor being pretty salty and it again being very oily.

I came here for the bun bo hue after reading a few positive reviews.  It was disappointing.  The dish looked more like a Chinese beef stew with noodles then an authentic bun bo hue.  I didn't see any pork blood cake in my soup and the pork leg was tiny.  Search elsewhere if you looking for an authentic bun bo hue.  I didn't try anything else there so can't comment on other menu items but the place looks clean and the staff was friendly.

Solid Vietnamese food in Las Vegas.
Found this place on Yelp before heading back home and decided to give it a try.  Their dishes are decent and price is right.  The service was very friendly as well.  It's a good place to get some authentic Vietnamese food.
Will come around again.

Pro:
1.  Solid food
2.  Great price
3.  Great service

Con:
Nothing outstanding to mention.
Food and service are always great.      Love this little family place.    Its my go to for pho
Delish finally a nice waitress

Nice & neat
Seafood soup! They will customize food for you.
Egg rolls are nice and tasty. They come with leafs of salad, done other vegetables and special sauce.
Broccoli with shrimps are tasty too.

First time having Pho in years! I saw the great reviews so I thought I would give it a try. I was not disappointed. I had the raw beef Pho. It was great! The weather was chilly that day so it made for a great way to end the night! I recommend this place to anyone who like Pho or wants to try it for the first time! The Spring Rolls were great too!

Delicious pho broth, not too sweet and not to salty. Just right. I ordered a large pho chin, which is the beef brisket, my favorite meat for pho. The owner was very helpful, and nice. Got the free egg roll for checking in on yelp. Happy to see it is made with rice paper, not wheat.  Highly recommend this place!

Came here right when it opened at 10am. We got seated and although we told the guy we alrdy knew what we wanted, he took like 10 min to take our order. Another viet fam had came in after us and their order was taken before ours! No, my fam and I are not viet, we are cambodian LOL. Anyways, the four in my fam all order pho and I ordered the pork vermicelli bowl. It took awhile for our food to come out too! 

I did not tell my family nor the server, but there was f****ing fruit fly in my fish sauce! I didn't say anything because I didn't want my fam to lose their appetite since they were alrdy hesitant coming here. So I just scooped it out and used the extra sauce I asked for. My dish barely had any noodles....mainly veggies. That sucked. But it was still good, I guess. None of the workers came to check up on us or anything. 

Should have went with our other pho choice.

LOVE this place! From the iced coffee, to the spring rolls this place is 
yummmmmmm!
Clean, friendly I was sold just walking through the door.
Hubby had Pho Ga, and I had a #1.
Don't forget to check in YELP for your two free egg rolls!
Go there and go fast! You will be happy!

I love pho! I used to be in Vietnam all the time and fell in love with the food. This place has the best pho and Vietnamese sandwiches in LV.  I love Vietnamese sandwiches! Pork party sandwiches soups and spring rolls are my favorites.  So this place  takes the win as my favorite Vietnamese place. The owners here are really great too and always take care of me! Highly recommended

I wanted to try another pho spot and Kinh Do was the first one I saw while driving up Spring Mountain. 

I ordered my usual, Pho Tai w/Tripe and always with my beef on the side. I liked that they gave me 2 slices of lime. The bean sprouts were fresh and clean. The soup came out steaming hot! The broth was a little bland. The noodles and beef were good. They skimped on the tripe though.

This is one of those restaurants where you pay at the counter when you are done. I walked up to the counter and waited while the guy finished making more tea. He turns around after a few minutes and asks me if I'm ready...why else would I be standing here with my wallet in my hand...

Went to Kinh Do with my son the first time, the Pho broth was very good and of course, the Pho itself was very good. My son got the beef stew with the rice noodle, the flavor was good but the meat was a little fatty. The second time I went with my family and again, the Pho was very good all around. It had a very flavor. The service was good, you didn't have to wait forever to get a refill on water. Highly recommend this place. Can't complain.

Good pho portion size reasonable
There is no basil
 NOT authentic

I have always relied on yelp to get me places. I was very disappointed with this place. Place was dirty, service was very slow and very small portions. Heavy MSG base! When we were there over the weekend this place was empty during rush hour. For those first timers stay away and go somewhere else. I would rather put my money into a slot machine!

Wow great pho and service! 

My gf and I loved it so much.

Complimentary check-in egg rolls were great as well!

Will come back next time :)
Great place to eat when you are near spring street. The Poa Tai is very good and comes in a large portion.  The parking is adequate during the rush hour. Highly recommend this place.
My go-to pho spot. Plus their banh mi is fantastic.

"Pho" sure this place is solid choice for some serious pho cravings.  Check in for your free eggrolls (eat these wrapped in the lettuce they give you and add the pickled veggies before you dip it in the sauce - AH-MAZING!).  Next order the Pho with whatever meats you like (i recommend rare sliced beef, tripe, & flank steak for a variety of flavors) AND a bahn mi (try the grilled pork!). 
Perfect Asian Soup and Sandwich meal! 
Service is quick, attentive, and VERY friendly!                                                  
We go here at least once a month for our pho/bahn mi fix! RECOMMEND! do it...

Can't quite give it 4 stars as much as I want to. Pho didn't have enough tendon/tripe and the broth was weak. Wish it was hotter too: the pepper and veggies didn't cook as much as I like. To be fair, I've had this complaint everywhere outside of a specific place in California.

The recommended Bun Bo Hue was much more interesting and I hadn't had it before. The Thai iced teas were pretty good but I like them a little stronger.

There's so many Vietnamese pho spots around here that I probably won't be back even though the service was stellar.

We love the food at Kinh Do in China Town
Food is fresh and yummy
Prices are fair 
We will be back for sure
I am Vietnamese go there for vacation and this place Pho is good. I do not like "bun bo" because too much oil in it. Pho is the best in this place

We came here as an alternative to Pho Kim Long, which is always frequented when in Vegas.  The only things better about this place than PKL are that it's cheaper and they have really generous portions.  

The food was meh.  Their nem nuong rolls are huge, but that's cause they stuff it with lots of vermicelli noodle.  The nem nuong itself resembles and taste like sausage.... no pun intended. And theres like 2 pieces of it..  It wasn't terrible - just not very nem nuongish..

The rice plate that I had (bbq pork chop) was alright.  I thought it was a bit too salty.  And i asked for an egg over easy, but they fried the hell out of it.

I didn't expect awesome service  - I never do when I go to a Vietnamese restaurant. But on top of mediocre food, they have terrible service.  Therefore, the verdict of this review is 2 stars.

I'm seriously just going to stick to eating on the strip next time I'm in Vegas

Service = 1/5 stars
Food= 2/5 stars 

First of all I unlocked the 2 free egg rolls and showed the waitress. She looked pissed off and said "oh...yeah..u..got 2 free egg roll" and never brought it out. 

When I eat pho I like for the broth to be  HOTTT, I like my glasses to look like my eyeballs are chillin in a sauna. Tell me why after about 2 minutes my bowl went cold. 

My friend got the vermicelli and they gave him literally 2 pieces of pork belly. He said it tasted alright, he just wished they weren't so stingy. 

Oh yeah they were also playing Spanish music. Wtf?
Amazing banh mi - best I've had. The bread really separates it from other sandwiches. The pho is delicious too and the service is great. The owner was very nice too.

The place is always fast and friendly.. food taste very authentic and always fresh.. if you check in you also get 2 free eggrolls and the eggroll wraps are made with banh trang (rice paper) and very crispy when fried.  Nice and cool in there and very close to the strip.  Wish they were open later but they close at 10pm

I have mixed feelings about this place. So let's start with 3 stars and I'll explain myself.

I didn't have high expectations of finding amazing pho in Vegas. However, after a serious night of drinking, my friends and I were desperately in need of pho recovery. I yelped and found the closest location, whcih was Kinh Do.

First we started off with the charbroiled pork spring rolls. The vegis were fresh and the rolls were wrapped tight, which was good. But the charbroiled pork had a weird spam like texture. I didn't dislike it, but it wasn't what I was expecting. They give you two types of peanut sauce, which was pretty great.

Next, I had the pho with sliced beef and tripe. The sliced beef was very fresh and tender. However, the broth was extremeley bland and disappointing. I kept adding sriracha and hoisin sauce, then more basil, just to get some flavor out of my soup.

Since we had a long trip ahead of us, we grabbed some bahn mi sandwiches to-go. The sammiches were pretty great. The bread was fresh and had perfect amount of crunchness on the outside. The jalapenos were pretty spicy and I ended up removing most. For $3, these were definitely the best part of Kinh Do.

There were many other pho places on the map, so i probably wouldn't try this place again.

Food was good, the amount was pretty large didnt expect it to be good since there only a few people in the place. They are known  for their bahn mi which I should have ordered instead of the rice dishes. The soup that my wife got was really good. We definitely will visit this place again this time im getting the Bahn Mi

Missing Viet food after 5 days in Vegas so I decided to give a try in this restaurant for breakfast. We got the vermicelli with grill shrimp (B5) and the Hu tieu nam vang kho (13- I guess?) B5 is really yummy but the hu tieu has too much noodle. I got like a whole bowl of noodles and only a few pieces of meat. It would be nice if they give a less noodle so it will perfectly fit with the meat. I can't finish it all as I have to ask for extra sauce for noodles which is a little bit better. Service seemed like understaffed as there are only 2 people working in the front. It's hard to call them to ask for what you want cause they have to be in rush even though there are only 4 tables. The thai tea was ok, a little bit sweet but acceptable. Vietnamese coffee is yummy, I love it! Highly recommend.
best pho spot i i've eaten in vegas. eggs rolls are great. i come here all the time and i travel all the way from summerlin just to eat the pho, sandwiches and egg rolls.
Large portion and a fair price! Sure beats the Pho spot I was contemplating inside T.I.

Came to Pho Kinh Do on the recommendation of a close friend. I was impressed by the cleanliness of the restaurant as a whole and the service here is very friendly. Ambience is nice too as they have some TVs usually showing news or sports, and generally play pretty good music. Anyone who is a fan of hip-hop dance violinist Lindsey Stirling will enjoy the music here as the several times I went, Lindsey Stirling was played quite often.

As for the food itself, I would say it is average, maybe a bit above average. Nothing especially amazing here, but the environment and service make it an enjoyable restaurant experience regardless. I tried the pho dac biet (special), fried egg rolls (cha gio), and the Vietnamese drip coffee. All were pretty standard, which can seem like a bad thing to some, but I actually appreciate the consistency!

Solid restaurant!

Mixed feelings about this place, but they have rock-bottom prices and some of the best bahn mi in town. Bread isn't always the freshest, but it's surprisingly packed with ingredients (and not just the veggies!) for under $4. Fresh spring rolls are an okay choice, but the soup we had was basic and unremarkable. Props for offering free eggrolls with check in (dine in only). I'll come back for the dac biet.

saw their yelp check in deal - 2 free egg rolls. 
we got their #1 pho which included beef brisket, tendon, and flank .. a generous size for $7. 
the only complaint was their veggies (bean sprouts) did not look very fresh. 

overall, good place in a sketchy area. strange that there was no one there but us on peak dining hours though.
Quite good Pho. The large size is truly large, hard to finish it without a good appetite. Overall quick service and everything else was good.

So much better than pho kim long especially in terms of service and ingredients! It is also less crowded and has a much bigger parking lot. They also let you pay separately at the register! :D 

The servers are very polite and food came quickly. The sauces and utensils are fully stocked at all the tables I can see. 

The pho soup is not oily and the bean sprouts/lime/etc was rly rly fresh!
My favorite pho place in Vegas out of all the ones I've tried! Best broth and the special pho has all the meats you would expect in a special pho! My husband loves the sandwiches here too!

Last day in Vegas otw home... Decided that we wanted Vietnamese food and saw that this place was 4 stars and the reviews were good.. Kind of a struggle to get here because we got a little lost trying to get into the plaza (i know I know... But hey I wasn't driving) point is... We almost gave up and just eat at Panda Express in Boulder City.. Boy am I glad we pushed through..

This place is really busy which is always a good sign.. And it was clean :) service was pretty good and fast but the food took a good amount of time to get on our table (not a bad sign at a restaurant) only when we are starving lol

Then there's the free eggrolls for check in! Yasssss! So good!

My man and I decided to get pho (gave up rice for Lent) and split a Banh Mi! I got the house special number 5 and he got the Pho Thai Nam.. Both were good!! 

My bowl was huge and full of meat yumm! And the broth is delicious! It's really uptherewith one ofmy favorite pho places... Def would come back here.

That Banh Mi tho.. We got the grilled bbq pork. This was my first time trying Banh Mi and omg soooo good! Hopefully this place don't set my Banh Mi standards too high but I'm also glad it was my first experience! The bbq pork was sweet and the pickeled veggies with the cilantro went so well with the toasted bread yummm! Took out the slices of jalapenos tho..so be careful with that if you don't like spicy.

This was a great experience!! Can't wait to come back!

I wanted to like this place more. it looks like an authentic vietnamese restaurant in san jose, and they serve bun bo hue, which is usually a plus. i usually end up at treasure island for pho, since spring mtn rd is so far, but the lure of the real deal brought me out here.
first the good - the vegetables (bean sprouts, basil, etc) were fresh. no complaints here. when they brought these out first, i was quite excited as quality ingredients usually means quality fare.
now the bad - i ordered pho (was tempted to try the BBH, but my stomach was recovering from some crazy vegas partying and needed something lighter). i believe it was the #5, with everything. the portion was decent sized. the broth, however, lacked depth. it wasn't bad, per se, but just lacked any complexity. i usually eat my pho plain for about a quarter of a bowl before i add in siracha, eat that for a bit, then add in additional condiments. that keeps it fresh and it's like i'm having 3 different flavored bowls of noodles in one sitting. this time, i couldn't take more than a few spoonfuls of plain broth before i was thoroughly bored with it. just does not compare to san jose pho.
The best Vietnamese food and nice size portions!  Walked out of Kinh Do full, normally doesn't happen in Hawaii!  Bonus:  got my free egg rolls with check-in!
A reasonably good Vietnamese restaurant. I like the food and quick service . Price is pretty reasonable. This place is probably the nicest restaurant in Vegas.

The service was very friendly and they get most of their stars for that. The menu was fairly limited compared to some of the other pho/Vietnamese food restaurants.  The check in offer was a free order of egg rolls. Since we came early in the AM, he had to check if they had any prepared yet. Turns out they did, and they were fresh and delicious. But, unfortunately I am pretty sure they ended up charging us for it. The pho was bland and extremely forgettable. I really fail to see where these high ratings are stemming from. They skimped on everything AND the broth tasted like hot water until I added sriracha, then it tasted like sriracha water. The bathroom looked like it doubled as a broom closet. I don't have any reason to go back or recommend this place to friends.

Went here the other day as a recommendation from a friend. Let me say this.... so yummy!

First off it doesn't look like much from the outside but when you go into the restaurant it is very clean. We were immediately seated and handed menus. I knew what I wanted already as did my mom but when you take a picky 14 yr old with you, looking over the menu could take days!!!! 

We weren't rushed to order at all. My son finally decided what he wanted. We order the egg rolls, rare steak pho, chicken pho, and shrimp fried rice. The egg rolls came out quickly and were so hot and fresh. The condiments they bring with them were all fresh, cool and delicious. I like how they bring the dipping sauce in individual bowls so everyone has their own.

A few moments later our entrees came out. A big bowl of pho is just what the dr ordered!! The bean sprouts, limes, basil, and jalapeños were super fresh! My rare steak pho had the best flavor and noodle overload which I appreciate because a lot of places tend to not give you a bunch of noodles!! My son loved his shrimp fried rice and my mom said her chicken pho was the best she has ever had! 

The only reason I gave 4 stars is because the bathroom was kind of gross. There were no seat covers for the toilet, no soap and no paper towels. But aside from that the food was awesome and we will be returning!!

Being Asian, I've been making monthly trips to Vegas since I was 5!

I hardly eat on the Strip and venture to Chinatown for cheap eats. So glad we found a decent Vietnamese place. Pho is seasoned well. Only complaint is how thick they cut their meat- it was hard to bite.

Also tried the bun bo hue which was very good. Had lots of lemongrass flavors. I was missing my pork leg, which is the star of this soup, so I waved down the server. She said they ran out so just added more of the other meats in there. Disappointed with that. Again-- meat was sliced really thick here too.

My sister had the bun rieu and said it tasted very close to how we make it at home. I would definitely come back next month and judging from the constant flow of customers, this place was the hot spot!

So.. Pho Bosa was closed yet again, which puts us in the awkward position of looking for a different Pho place, knowing that disappointment was likely. While I'm searching nearby restaurants, I noticed Marie T. had checked in here just a few hours prior so of course I shoot her over a text to ask how it was. With her approval, we waltzed over. 

Checked in and got the complimentary egg rolls, which were amazing- on par to the egg rolls my mother makes, which is a huge since I was starting to think my mother made the best I would ever have. 

We both had the #5 pho, which is the typical "special" pho dish served up everywhere; it had tripe, brisket, rare steak, beef meatballs (which were especially good here), narrow cut rice noodles in a phenomenal beef broth. It was really great. Definitely as good as (if not BETTER) than Pho Bosa, and the amazing egg rolls (better than PB) are what put it over the top.

Beyond that, this restaurant seems to be reliable. As in, open when it's supposed to be- no showing up with a note on the door saying the staff is out sick, or spending time with family. And I believe that they're open 7 days a week. 

This is our new #1 Pho place.
We all ordered 4 diff types of noodle soups and some fresh spring rolls. Everything was flavorful and yummy! We will be back.

This place is the bomb, and truly a hidden gem! I found it on Yelp a year ago when I was visiting for a bachelorette party. Naturally, I HAD to make it a point to come again when I was in Vegas this past weekend. It is SO GOOD. The pho and the bun bo hue are easily in the top best I've ever had. So much so that I almost missed my flight last year because I wanted to bring some Togo for my bf. Not much more to say than, do yourself a favor and check this place out! It's only like 2 miles from the strip. I recommend uber over taxi when coming here, it's definitely cheaper.

Amazing food with a great price! We came to the restaurant around 8pm the day after the Xmas, and lots of food has already been sold out. They don't have the baguette anymore to make banh mi, which shows how popular the food is. 

It is the first time we tried the pork petty roll (nem nuong cuon). We were skeptical at first, but wow, it was amazing, better than the shrimp roll we got. We also ordered pho (with rare beef and well-done flank), and the soup has the exact right flavor. The pho combination was awesome. Highly recommended this place as a cheap and great alternative from the overly-priced food on the strip.

Amazing authetic vietnamese! Just what we needed on our way out of vegas. The cure of cures. Huge bowls of pho and delicious to the last drop. Bahn mi sandwiches are super tasty and super cheap! Definitely worth a stop if youre in the area

Did my first check in at this place to get some free egg rolls with our meal. Some of my friends had come out from Asia and wanted some Asian noodle soup so that's how we ended up eating in China town of Vegas instead of on the strip. The space was really big and not too crowded when we went. Most got the pho and one got the banh mi and we all loved our dishes. The owner had told us that they had only been open a year and business was really competitive in that area. 

I know there are tons of Vietnamese places in that area but please try this one. We all thought it was very good. The noodles were a good consistency and the broth was complex and hopefully took a couple days to get the rigth flavor.

The owner works his butt off, the prices were good, and the space was clean. Eat here!
Great services at a reasonable price!! I alway stop by here when I come to visit! Food is good.

Went there today for lunch. Don't get scared by the plaza. The place is clean, not busy and we were served immediately. Waitress was my perfect type - shows up only if I look to her. I don't like to be asked every 5 min if everything is ok and if I want something else right I after I stuff my mouth. I know this is what most Americans expect from a server, but not me. 
I am really happy with the pork BBQ Pho. I was skeptical about it at first because of the red color of the meat, but the taste was rich and  smoky. 
The fresh basil, sprouts and lime turned the bowl into a spring garden. 
I am definitely going back again
Really like the Bun Rieu here, portion is large cant finish myself. They put lots of crab meat and shrimp. The service is not quite well though.
Broth of the bun rieu was good but be ready to pay 8.95 for just noodles n 4 small shrimp

Stopped by Kinh Do during my last Vegas trip. The group was in dire need of Pho, but we decided to try something different than Pho Kim Long, plus their lines are crazy. Found Kinh Do, and this place is great! There was a line of ppl waiting, but we were able to get seating immediately due to our party size (7 ppl). Some of the ppl got their 30 mins later due to car issues at the valet, but the staff was very understanding and accommodating. Their pho is good and hit the spot. We got the free egg rolls from the yelp check-in, and they were super crispy and def worth getting. 

Not only is their food delicious, but their staff is probably one of the best I've experience for a Vietnamese Pho restaurant. They even helped call us a cab and chit-chatted with us when we were hanging out after our meal. Will def go back the next time in Vegas and craving Pho. Read good things about the BBH, so I'm looking forward to trying that.
All over the Western US and Canada and this is the best pho I've ever had. Would hate to leave Vegas and leave Pho Kinh Do behind.

Your typical Vietnamese restaurant with a good selection of traditional entrees.  A plus is the selection of Vietnamese sandwiches. I like this spot because it is close to the strip and it is not always crowded like Pho So 1 (which I don't like anymore, because it got too popular for its own good).  Their pho is decent and their bun bo hue is really flavorful.  Service is prompt.  

If you check-in on Yelp, they will give you 2 complimentary egg rolls; really good with nice crunch and a plate of veggies to roll them in and dipping sauce.

John is the bomb dot com! This place is awesome for banh mi sandwiches. But be aware, they can sometimes sell out. So get 'em while you can! 

As for the rest of the menu, standard Vietnamese pho fare. Perfect for first-meal-day-after-a-night-of-dubachery.

Be prepared for a little wait Saturday and Sunday noon times. :)  or call ahead to make reservations! ^_^
Food was alright.... Nothing too special. I had a Ban Xeo and I believe I had better.

We came here because our favorite Vietnamese restaurant was closed for 'electrical repairs.'  How crazy is that?  This restaurant was clean, the service was nice.  Don't forget to check in so you can get your 2 free cha gio egg rolls, which were hot and crunchy, great wrapped in the greens with mint and the nuoc mam dipping sauce was fine (not as flavorful as our fav place, but fine).  I prefer the leafy green lettuce, but they used romaine.  My usual grilled shrimp w/grilled pork over vermicelli was ok, the pork a little overdone and chunky vs the thinner slices that are so much tender.  Our caramelized short ribs were good.  I don't recommend the clay pot caramelized fish unless you enjoy skimpy portions of fish in overcooked sugar sauce and you like spitting out the bones.
